title: NAACP Secretary White on 1919 Chicago - purpose

content.question: Which statement best explains the significance of the authorâ€™s purpose in writing this article?

choices.label: By attributing the unrest in northern urban areas to political corruption and economic competition, the author is dismissing white racism as a cause of violence.
By recounting the violent events in Chicago during the summer of 1919, the publisher is marking the official end of the era of the Civil War and Reconstruction.
By highlighting the role of the Great Migration in the rise of racial violence in the North, the author is blaming the African American community for the unrest.
By identifying the causes of the racial violence in Chicago, the author is resisting white supremacy through political activism and by publishing accounts of violence.

content.answer: By identifying the causes of the racial violence in Chicago, the author is resisting white supremacy through political activism and by publishing accounts of violence.
